Class Villain

  • java.lang.Object
    • Villain
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bucephalus, Evan, Invictus, Janken, John, Maverick

    public class Villain
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of the Villain class represent opponents the player will face in the game. Outside of testing, the Villain class should not be instantiated directly, but rather through its subclasses. Each subclass of Villain should be instantiated at most once to avoid duplicate encounters in the game.

      Modifier and Type Field Description

      private boolean isDefeated
      Initialised to false when the villain is created, and set to false once the villain has been defeated three times in a mini game.
      static int MAX_TIMES_DEFEATED
      The number of times a villain can lose MiniGames before it is killed.
      private java.lang.String name
      The name of the villain.
      private static java.lang.Class<?>[] REGULAR_VILLAINS
      An array of class objects of all the villain subclasses except the super villain, to be used when initialising the list of villains in a new game.
      private static java.lang.Class<?> SUPER_VILLAIN
      The class object of the super villain, to be used when initialising the list of villains in a new game.
      private java.lang.String taunt
      The taunt which the villan displays when battling a hero.
      private int timesDefeated
      The number of times this villain has been defeated in a MiniGame.

    • Field Detail

      • SUPER_VILLAIN

        private static final java.lang.Class<?> SUPER_VILLAIN
        The class object of the super villain, to be used when initialising the list of villains in a new game.

      • REGULAR_VILLAINS

        private static final java.lang.Class<?>[] REGULAR_VILLAINS
        An array of class objects of all the villain subclasses except the super villain, to be used when initialising the list of villains in a new game.

      • MAX_TIMES_DEFEATED

        public static final int MAX_TIMES_DEFEATED
        The number of times a villain can lose MiniGames before it is killed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        The name of the villain. Each subclass of Villain has a different name.

      • taunt

        private java.lang.String taunt
        The taunt which the villan displays when battling a hero. Each subclass of Villain has a different taunt.

      • damageDealt

        private int damageDealt
        The damage to a hero's health when it loses a battle to this villain. Each subclass of Villain has a different damage dealt.

      • gamesPlayed

        private MiniGameType[] gamesPlayed
        An array of the games a villain may choose to play, represented as values of the enum type MiniGame. Each game on the list has an equal probability of being chosen. Each subclass of Villain has a different list of games played.

      • timesDefeated

        private int timesDefeated
        The number of times this villain has been defeated in a MiniGame.

      • isDefeated

        private boolean isDefeated
        Initialised to false when the villain is created, and set to false once the villain has been defeated three times in a mini game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Villain

        public Villain​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String taunt,
               int damageDealt,
               MiniGameType[] gamesPlayed)
        Constructor called from the constructors of the subclasses of Villain. Sets the attribute variables of the villain to the values defined by the particular subclass.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Villain subclass.
        taunt - The taunt displayed by the Villian subclass.
        damageDealt - The damage dealt by the Villain subclass.
        gamesPlayed - The list of games which are played by the villain subclass.

    • Method Detail

      • randomisedVillains

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Villain> randomisedVillains​(int numVillains)
        Creates an ArrayList of instances of Villain subclasses of the given length. Called when creating a new game to initialise the villain in each city. The last villain in list is the super villain, and the other villains are randomised from the list of regular villains. There are no repeated villains.
        Parameters:
        numVillains - The length of the returned list of villains. Must be at least one (always includes the super villain).
        Returns:
        The randomised list of villains, with the super villain last.
